data.title: The Syriac Sources Relating to the Persecution of the Christians of Najran in South Arabia
data.abstractNote: «The present paper will concentrate very briefly on three points on which we have particular information in the Syriac texts, and mainly in the first letter, edited by Guidi. First, it throws light on the penetration of Judaism in Arabia, including the south of the peninsula, before the Hegira. Secondly, it reveals some aspects of Christological controversies in the Near East in the sixth century precisely at the moment when separate churches began to be organised; finally, it will bring into relief , the special link which is made between kingship and truthfulness, and the cultural and intellectual background of this concept.» (P. 45)
